com.ambrosus.utils

Class JsonUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ambrosus.utils.JsonUtils

  • public abstract class JsonUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for Json-related operations.

    • Method Detail

      • recursiveSort

        public static com.google.gson.JsonObject recursiveSort(com.google.gson.JsonObject json)
        Sorts the JsonObject properties by alphabetical order of the keys. The passed object is not modified. Inner JsonObject are sorted recursively. JsonArray are not sorted but this function is called recursively on their contents.
        Parameters:
        json - The JsonObject to be sorted
        Returns:
        A new JsonObject with identical properties but sorted

      • arraySort

        public static com.google.gson.JsonArray arraySort(com.google.gson.JsonArray jsonArray)
        Sort each JsonElement of the array individually. Note that the relative order of elements within the array is not changed.
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - The array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        A new array, whose elements were individually sorted.

      • elementWithPath

        public static com.ambrosus.utils.Optional<com.google.gson.JsonElement> elementWithPath(com.google.gson.JsonObject jsonObject,
                                                                                       java.lang.String path)
        Call elementWithPath(JsonObject, String, Character) with the '|' (pipe) separator

      • elementWithPath

        public static com.ambrosus.utils.Optional<com.google.gson.JsonElement> elementWithPath(com.google.gson.JsonObject jsonObject,
                                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                                       java.lang.Character separator)
        Finds the JsonElement within a JsonObject whose position in the hierarchy matches the provided path. A path is specified using a single string where each level is separated by a separation character.

        Example: 

         {
   "field1": "value",
   "field2": {
     "nestedField": "nestedValue"
   }
 }
        Assuming '|' is used as a separation character, the nested value can be accessed by providing "field2 |nestedField" as the path.
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - The JsonObject on which to perform the search.
        path - The path to the JsonElement.
        separator - The separation character used in the path to distinguish levels in the object's hierarchy.
        Returns:
        An Optional JsonElement value.
